TopicTitle: Dunderhead question: Why is "post new reply" not posting new replies?

Articles.Content:
I'm sure I'm looking right at the solution, but just am too thick today to figure it out. I'm trying to create a thread in the Spacecraft Exchange forum for my creations, but every time I try to post a new post, it appends on the end of my first post, rather than creating a new one. Is this default behavior, or did I miss a setting somewhere? Thanks guys. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Okay, I don't get it. After I got logged out and logged back in, NOW it's making new replies? What gives?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-07T22:37:21Z" title="04/07/2015 10:37  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 7, 2015</time> by KristopherKerblumbus**

Merging "new posts" with old posts by the same user is default action to keep thread cluttering to a minimum.

Though you can make new posts after the old one after a certain amount of time, or so I've found in the past.
The cool down timer on the auto-merge function is 30 minutes.

You shouldn't need to create additional posts. If you need to link to specific sections in your post (to make a table of contents, or something like that), you can use the goto and line BBCodes, like so:

    [noparse][goto=tagname]This is a link to the line marked 'tagname'[/goto]....[line=tagname]This will appear as normal text, so you can format it as a heading or what have you.[/line][/noparse]
